data.message:
كان في بوست من فترة كذا حد عنده مشكلة في سرعة النت على digital ocean 
وبيفضلوا linode
ممكن تدور على البوست مش هعرف اجيبهولك دلوقتي

اعتقد لو مشكلتك cpu زي ما مكتوب ف مش هينفع تروح على سيرفر 1 او 2 كور
ممكن تجرب البلان اللي فيها 4 كور لو مش كفاية ليك وقتها ممكن تعمل ابجريد للخطة اللي بعدها
بس تتأكد الاول انك عملت اللي عليك في السيرفر اللي انت عليه بمعنى انك مستخدم cache و الموضوع optimized قدر الامكان عشان متبقاش مشكلة كل سيرفر تروحه و مش هتخلص منها لو متحلتش

I prefer to use AWS 
it cost effective

حاليا linode افضل شيئ
لكن لو كان الخيار بيدي اختار aws ec2 / amazon lightsail

hmm, here's my $0.02:
digital ocean is not quite good for a stable production environment, mainly cause of some random networking issues.
amazon lightsail - as I read, but didn't try it - *seems* to be built on AWS's t-series, which IMHO is no good for production cause of CPU performance issues.
Vultr and linode are your best bet. I believe that linode is more mature and has better tools like ip swapping, automated backups, .. etc. Anyway the difference in pricing is minimal. When I benchmarked them both a few years ago vultr had significantly better CPU performance, but i'm not sure this is still the case.

Choosing the plan is based on your needs, but if you are going for linode then I suggest that you make the harddisk as small as the smallest plan - if you can of course - so you can scale up and down if needed. About how to migrate them this is the tricky part, both of them doesn't support CPanel so you'll have to build your stack - and client isolation - from scratch.. may be separate php-fpm pools as a starter, or docker containers if you will..
